translations.text: Ha'. Mim.
This Book is a revelation from the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181328">1</sup>
Behold, for those who believe<sup foot_note="181329">1</sup> there are (myriad) Signs in the heavens and the earth
and in your own creation; and in the animals which He spreads out over the earth too there are Signs for those endowed with sure faith;<sup foot_note="181330">1</sup>

and in the succession of night and day,<sup foot_note="181331">1</sup> and in the provision<sup foot_note="181332">2</sup> that Allah sends down from the sky wherewith He gives life to the earth after it had been lifeless,<sup foot_note="181333">3</sup> and in the change of the winds:<sup foot_note="181334">4</sup> (in all these) there are Signs for people who use reason.
These are Allah's Signs that We rehearse to you in Truth. In what kind of discourse after Allah and His Signs will they, then, believe?<sup foot_note="181335">1</sup>
Woe to every guilty impostor

who hears Allah's Signs being rehearsed to him, and yet persists in his pride, as though he had not heard it.<sup foot_note="181336">1</sup> Announce to him, then, the tidings of a grievous chastisement.
Whenever he comes to know anything of Our Signs, he makes them an object of jest.<sup foot_note="181337">1</sup> For such there awaits a humiliating chastisement.

Hell is behind them.<sup foot_note="181338">1</sup> Their worldly earnings shall not avail them, nor those whom they took as protectors instead of Allah.<sup foot_note="181339">2</sup> An awesome chastisement lies in store for them.
This (Qur'an) is the true guidance. Those who deny the Signs of their Lord shall suffer the torment of a woeful scourge.

Allah it is Who has subjected the sea to you so that ships may sail upon it at His bidding<sup foot_note="181340">1</sup> and you may seek of His Bounty<sup foot_note="181341">2</sup> and give thanks to Him.

He has subjected to you all that is in the heavens and the earth,<sup foot_note="181342">1</sup> all being from Him.<sup foot_note="181343">2</sup> Verily there are Signs in this for those who reflect.<sup foot_note="181344">3</sup>

(O Prophet), tell the believers to indulge those who have no fear of any evil days coming upon them from Allah<sup foot_note="181345">1</sup> so that Allah may Himself requite them for their deeds.<sup foot_note="181346">2</sup>
Whoever acts righteously, does so to his own good; and whoever commits an evil will suffer its consequence. All of you will then be sent back to your Lord.

Indeed We endowed the Children of Israel with the Book and Wisdom<sup foot_note="181347">1</sup> and Prophethood, and provided them with good things<sup foot_note="181348">2</sup> as sustenance, and exalted them above the peoples of the whole world.

We gave them clear directions in matters pertaining to religion. Yet they differed among themselves (not out of ignorance but) after knowledge had come to them; and they did so out of the desire to commit excesses against one another.<sup foot_note="181349">1</sup> On the Day of Resurrection Allah will judge among them regarding what they had differed.
And then We set you, (O Prophet), on a clear high road in religious matters.<sup foot_note="181350">1</sup> So follow that and do not follow the desires of those who do not know.
Surely they will be of no avail to you against Allah.<sup foot_note="181351">1</sup> Indeed the wrong-doers are friends of each other, whereas Allah is the friend of the God-fearing.
These are the lights of discernment for people and guidance and mercy for those endowed with sure faith.<sup foot_note="181352">1</sup>

Do<sup foot_note="181353">1</sup> the evil-doers imagine that We shall make them equal to those who believe and do good, making their lives and deaths alike? How vile is their judgement!<sup foot_note="181354">2</sup>
Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth<sup foot_note="181355">1</sup> that each person may be requited for his deeds. They shall not be wronged.<sup foot_note="181356">2</sup>

Did you ever consider the case of him who took his desire as his god,<sup foot_note="181357">1</sup> and then Allah caused him to go astray despite knowledge,<sup foot_note="181358">2</sup> and sealed his hearing and his heart, and cast a veil over his sight?<sup foot_note="181359">3</sup> Who, after Allah, can direct him to the Right Way? Will you not take heed?<sup foot_note="181360">4</sup>

They say: “There is no life other than our present worldly life: herein we live and we die, and it is only (the passage of) time that destroys us. Yet the fact is that they know nothing about this and are only conjecturing.<sup foot_note="181361">1</sup>
And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them,<sup foot_note="181362">1</sup> their only contention is: “Bring back to us our fathers if you are truthful.”<sup foot_note="181363">2</sup>

Tell them, (O Prophet): “It is Allah Who gives you life and then causes you to die,<sup foot_note="181364">1</sup> and He it is Who will then bring all of you together on the Day of Resurrection, a Day regarding which there can be no doubt.<sup foot_note="181365">2</sup> Yet most people do not know.<sup foot_note="181366">3</sup>

Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth,<sup foot_note="181367">1</sup> and on the Day when the Hour (of Resurrection) shall come to pass, the followers of falsehood shall be in utter loss.

On that Day you shall see every people fallen on their knees.<sup foot_note="181368">1</sup> Every people will be summoned to come forth and see its Record and will be told: “Today you shall be requited for your deeds.
This is Our Record which bears witness against you with truth; We used to record all what you did.”<sup foot_note="181369">1</sup>
As for those who believe and act righteously, their Lord shall admit them to His Mercy. That indeed is the manifest triumph.
But those who denied the Truth, they shall be told: “Were My Signs not rehearsed to you? But you waxed proud<sup foot_note="181370">1</sup> and became a guilty people.”

And when it was said to them: “Surely Allah's promise is true, and there is no doubt regarding the Hour of Resurrection,” you were wont to say: “We do not know what the Hour (of Resurrection) is. We are simply making conjectures and are not at all certain.”<sup foot_note="181371">1</sup>
(On that Day) the evil of their deeds will become apparent to them<sup foot_note="181372">1</sup> and what they had mocked at will encompass them,
and it will be said: “We will forget you today as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours. The Fire shall now be your abode, and you shall have none to come to your aid.

You reached this end because you made Allah's Signs an object of jest and the life of the world deluded you.” So they shall not be taken out of the Fire nor shall they be asked to make amends (and thus please their Lord).<sup foot_note="181373">1</sup>
So all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the heavens, the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the whole Universe.
His is the glory in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.
